com.xilinx.rapidwright.device

Class Tile

  • Object
    • com.xilinx.rapidwright.device.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable

    public class Tile
extends Object
implements Serializable
    Tiles are one of basic building blocks of Xilinx FPGAs. This class represents an instance of a tile type (CLB, INT, DSP, BRAM, ...) with sites, wires and PIPs. The fabric is composed of a 2D array of tiles.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getDevice

        public Device getDevice()
        Gets the device to which this tile belongs.
        Returns:
        The device to which this tile belongs.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireConnections

        public List<Wire> getWireConnections(int wire)
        This will get all of the forward wire connections that can be made from the given wire in this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_nodes -downhill -of_objects [get_nodes -of [get_wires -of $tile -filter INDEX==$wire]]]

        Parameters:
        wire - A wire in this tile to query its potential connections.
        Returns:
        An array of wires which connect to the given wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireConnections

        public List<Wire> getWireConnections(String wireName)
        This will get all of the forward wire connections that can be made from the given wire in this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_nodes -downhill -of_objects [get_nodes -of [get_wires -of $tile/$wireName]]]

        Parameters:
        wire - A wire in this tile to query its potential connections.
        Returns:
        An array of wires which connect to the given wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSites

        public Site[] getSites()
        Gets and returns the site array for this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_sites -of [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        An array of sites present in this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSiteIndex

        public int getSiteIndex(Site s)
        Get's the index of this site within the tile's site array.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set l [get_sites -of $this; for {set i 0} {$i < [llength $l]} {incr i} { puts [lindex $l $i]; if {[lindex $l $i]==$s} { set j $i}}; $j

        Parameters:
        s - The site with the index in question.
        Returns:
        The index of the site in the tile or -1 if not present.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Gets and returns the name of the tile (such as INT_X0Y5).

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property NAME [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        the name The name of the tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileTypeEnum

        public TileTypeEnum getTileTypeEnum()
        Gets the type of this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property TILE_TYPE [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        the type The current type of this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getRow

        public int getRow()
        The absolute row index (0 starting at top)

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property ROW [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        the row
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getColumn

        public int getColumn()
        The absolute column index (0 starting at the left)

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property COLUMN [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        the column
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getUniqueAddress

        public int getUniqueAddress()
        Gets a unique integer address for this tile (useful for representing a tile as a single integer).

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property INDEX [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        The unique integer address of this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileYCoordinate

        public int getTileYCoordinate()
        This is the Y Coordinate in the tile name (the 5 in INT_X0Y5)

        Vivado Tcl:

        set n [get_property NAME $this]; string range $n [expr [string last "Y" $n] + 1] [expr [string length $n] - 1]

        Returns:
        the tileRow
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileXCoordinate

        public int getTileXCoordinate()
        This is the X Coordinate in the tile name (the 0 in INT_X0Y5)

        Vivado Tcl:

        set n [get_property NAME $this]; string range $n [string last "X" $n]+1 [string last "Y" $n]-1

        Returns:
        the tileColumn
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileNeighbor

        public Tile getTileNeighbor(int columnOffset,
                            int rowOffset)
        Gets the row,column neighbor tile in the fabric
        Parameters:
        columnOffset - The column offset within the fabric grid
        rowOffset - The row offset within the fabric grid
        Returns:
        The row,column tile neighbor, or null if such an offset is off the grid of the fabric.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileXYNeighbor

        public Tile getTileXYNeighbor(int xOffset,
                              int yOffset)
        Gets the tile X,Y (not row and column) neighbor in the fabric by offsets. For example, calling this method on the tile INT_X5Y3 with the offsets xOffset=1, yOffset=-2 would return the tile INT_X(5+1)Y(3-2) = INT_X6Y1. A call to this method with (0,0) will return this tile.
        Parameters:
        xOffset - The X offset (positive increasing values of X)
        yOffset - The Y offset (positive increasing values of Y)
        Returns:
        The X,Y tile neighbor, or null if such an offset is off the grid of the fabric.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileNamePrefix

        public String getTileNamePrefix()
        Gets the prefix of the tile name, before "X#Y#". It includes the last underscore. For example: "INT_X23Y24" --> "INT_"

        Vivado Tcl:

        set n [get_property NAME $this]; string range $n 0 [string last "X" $n]-1

        Returns:
        The tile name prefix with trailing underscore.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getPIPs

        public ArrayList<PIP> getPIPs()
        This method will create a new list of PIPs that represent those in this Tile. Use this method with caution as it will generate a lot of new PIPs each time it is called which may use a lot of memory. O(n) runtime, where n is number of PIPs in the tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_pips -of [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        A list of all PIPs in this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getPIPs

        public ArrayList<PIP> getPIPs(String wireName)
        Creates a new list of PIPs that connect downhill to the provided wire name.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_pips -downhill -of [get_wires -of $tile -filter NAME=="$tile/$wireName"]

        Parameters:
        wire - The wire name to query.
        Returns:
        A list of downhill PIPs in this tile that can be driven from the specified wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getPIPs

        public ArrayList<PIP> getPIPs(int wire)
        Creates a new list of PIPs that connect downhill to the provided wire index.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_pips -downhill -of [get_wires -of $tile -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$startWire]

        Parameters:
        wire - The wire index to query.
        Returns:
        A list of downhill PIPs in this tile that can be driven from the specified wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getBackwardPIPs

        public ArrayList<PIP> getBackwardPIPs(String wireName)
        Creates a new list of PIPs that connect uphill to the provided wire.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_pips -uphill -of [get_wires -of $tile -filter NAME=="$tile/$wire"]

        Parameters:
        wireName - The wire name to query.
        Returns:
        A list of uphill PIPs in this tile that drive the specified wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getBackwardPIPs

        public ArrayList<PIP> getBackwardPIPs(int wire)
        Creates a new list of PIPs that connect uphill to the provided wire.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_pips -uphill -of [get_wires -of $tile -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$wire]

        Parameters:
        wire - The wire index to query.
        Returns:
        A list of uphill PIPs in this tile that drive the specified wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getManhattanDistance

        public int getManhattanDistance(Tile tile)
        Calculates the Manhattan distance between this tile and the given tile. It calculates the distance based on tileXCoordinate and tileYCoordinate rather than the absolute indices of the tile.
        Parameters:
        tile - The tile to compare against.
        Returns:
        The integer Manhattan distance between this and the given tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileManhattanDistance

        public int getTileManhattanDistance(Tile tile)
        Calculates Manhattan distance between this and the provided tile based on row and column indices.
        Parameters:
        tile - The other tile to use for the distance calculation.
        Returns:
        The row and column Manhattan distance for this and the provided tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

        public int getTilePatternIndex()

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property TILE_PATTERN_IDX [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        the tilePatternIndex
        Since:
        2019.2.2

      • getWireName

        public String getWireName(int wireIndex)
        Looks up the wire index in the tile type's name array.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set n [get_property NAME [get_wires -of $this -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$wireIndex]]; string range $n [string last "/" $n]+1 [expr [string length $n] - 1]

        Parameters:
        wireIndex - The specific wire
        Returns:
        The name of the wire as specified by the tile's type. Null if index is not valid.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireIndex

        public Integer getWireIndex(String wireName)
        Gets the ID or Index of the wire in the tile by wire name.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property ID_IN_TILE_TYPE [get_wires -of [get_tiles $tile] -filter NAME==$tile/$wireName]

        Parameters:
        wireName - Name of the wire in the tile to query.
        Returns:
        The wire index in the tile type, or null if none could be found by the provided name.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireCount

        public int getWireCount()
        Gets the number of wires within the tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        llength [get_wires -of_objects [get_tiles $tile]]

        Returns:
        Total wire count in this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getPIP

        public PIP getPIP(int wire0,
                  int wire1)
        Gets the PIP that exists between wire0 and wire1 in this tile.
        Parameters:
        wire0 - The first wire index of the PIP
        wire1 - The second wire index of the PIP
        Returns:
        The PIP between wire0 and wire1 or null if no PIP exists.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getBackwardConnections

        public ArrayList<Wire> getBackwardConnections(int wireID)
        Gets the list of wires driving the wire in this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_wires -uphill -of [get_nodes -of [get_wires -of [get_tile $tile] -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$wireID]]

        Parameters:
        wireID - The index of the wire in this tile.
        Returns:
        A list of wires that connect to the specified wire.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSitePinFromWire

        public SitePin getSitePinFromWire(int wireID)
        Gets the site pin corresponding to the wire of interest in the tile if it is connected.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_site_pins -of_objects [get_node -of [get_wires -of [get_tile $tile] -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$wireID]]

        Parameters:
        wireID - The wire index in the tile.
        Returns:
        The site pin connected to the specified wire, or null if none are connected.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireFromSitePin

        public Integer getWireFromSitePin(SitePin sitePin)
        Gets the wire in the this tile that connects to the provided site pin.

        Vivado Tcl:

        set l get_wires -of [get_nodes -of $sitePin];if [expr { [get_property DIRECTION $sitePin] eq "OUT" }] {lindex $l 0} else {lindex $l [llength $l]-1}

        Parameters:
        sitePin - The site pin to query.
        Returns:
        The wire index of the wire in this tile, or null couldn't be found.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getClockRegion

        public ClockRegion getClockRegion()
        Gets the ClockRegion to which this Tile belongs

        Vivado GUI:

        Tile Properties->Clock Regions

        Returns:
        The tile's clock region.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getSLR

        public SLR getSLR()
        Gets the SLR to which this tile belongs
        Returns:
        The SLR to which this tile belongs, or null if none could be found.
        Since:
        2019.2.0

      • getWireNames

        public String[] getWireNames()
        Gets an array of wire names (by wire index) for this tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        foreach w [get_wires -of_objects [get_tiles $tile]] {lappend names [string range $w [string last "/" $w]+1 [string length $w]] }; $names

        Returns:
        Array of wire names for this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getTileTypeIndex

        public int getTileTypeIndex()
        Gets the tile type index property of the tile.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property TILE_TYPE_INDEX [get_tiles $tile]

        Returns:
        The index of the tile type of this tile.
        Since:
        2018.2.0

      • getWireIntentCode

        public IntentCode getWireIntentCode(int wireID)
        Gets the intent code property for the wire.

        Vivado Tcl:

        get_property INTENT_CODE [get_wires -of [get_tiles $tile] -filter ID_IN_TILE_TYPE==$wireID]

        Parameters:
        wireID - The index of the wire of interest in the tile.
        Returns:
        The intent code for the wire of interest or null if couldn't be determined.
        Since:
        2018.2.0
